Postings.Text: Results and GC after the Bupa Stage 4 here...

Their lead was never more than 4:35 and the peloton led by Lotto-Belisol had taken big chunks out of that time well before the 2nd Jayco Sprint at Mt Pleasant. The race was back together after 101km and the scene was set for a showdown on Menglers. This is exactly what we saw and now with 45 riders within 12 seconds of SANTOS Tour Down Under race leader Martin Kohler (SUI) - BMC, the prospects for tomorrow could not be more exciting...or unpredictable.

Gatis Smukulis (LAT) - KAT, Ruben Perez (ESP) - EUS, Blel Kadri (FRA) - ALM and Jay McCarthy (AUS - Qld) - UNA finally got together around the 29 k mark but after the climb of Smith Hill the day’s first KOM (30.8km), Gatis Smukulis (LAT) - KAT dropped back leaving the three riders to establish the day’s main escape.

The strong performance by Michael Matthews (AUS) - RAB sees him take the lead in the Cycle Instead Young Rider classification while Rohan Dennis (AUS - SA) - UNA attack on Menglers Hill, which saw him summit first was enough for him to enter Jayco Stage 5 wearing the SKODA KOM jersey. Earlier, one of Dennis’ teammates Jay McCarthy (AUS - Qld) - UNA was involved in the day’s break that eventually formed after a flurry of early attacks in the first 30k’s.
Only nine seconds separates the top 10 riders with GreenEDGE’s main trump card Simon Gerrans  in 5th at eight seconds.

Kohler finished 32nd (but in the same time as Freire) to regain the Ochre Leaders jersey he claimed on Wednesday into Stirling. He leads Michael Matthews (AUS) - RAB and Oscar Freire (ESP) - KAT by just two seconds going into tomorrow’s penultimate and deciding Jayco Stage Five around the southern vales.

The biggest loser was Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB who was dropped on the climb up Menglers Hill and wasn’t able to bridge the gap once they reached the summit. Greipel finished in 55th, nearly eight minutes behind BUPA Stage 4 winner Oscar Freire (ESP) - KAT as he lead home a group of 48 including all the major contenders and the in-form Swiss BMC rider Martin Kohler (SUI) - BMC.

A few riders in the SANTOS TOUR DOWN UNDER peloton have been speaking about it for days and so it proved, today’s BUPA Stage 4 certainly shook up the General  Classification.

With so much attention on Willunga and Stirling, the eyes had been taken off the BUPA Stage a little but some riders knew the threat of Menglers Hill was always going to be a severe one.
